channel.title: [Known Issue]GUIDE Compiling and .bat issues cannot find path specified
channel.description:
Recently allot of people have been asking me in need to why there .bat/run/compile files wont work and come up with many errors
e.g cannot find path specified
[URL=http://img140.imageshack.us/my.php?image=compilererror.png][IMG]http://img140.imageshack.us/img140/8286/compilererror.png[/img][/URL]
I am going to show you how to fix this
First of all make sure you have downloaded the latest version of JDK
[b]HOW TO GET Java Development Tools[/b]
http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp
download the one that says java development kit (JDK)
then install it like you install anything else
[b]FIXING THE ERROR[/b]
Now go to
C:\Programfiles\java\jdk_1_6_0_13(the numbers on the end stand for what ever version you are this is important to know your version)
next click rename on the folder and [b]copy[/b] the name of it be exact
next go to the bat/compiler/run file that you are getting the error/errors from then right click on it and click [b]edit[/b]
then you should get a notepad open up with alotof text on it find where it says something similiar to wot you coped(the JDK version and paste your copy over the original which is there
then click save and now your bat/compiler/run file should work successfully and other problems please ask
[b]Thanks hope this guide helped[/b]

I am going to show you how to fix this

http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp

download the one that says java development kit (JDK)

then install it like you install anything else

FIXING THE ERROR

Now go to

C:\Programfiles\java\jdk_1_6_0_13(the numbers on the end stand for what ever version you are this is important to know your version)

next click rename on the folder and copy the name of it be exact

Thanks hope this guide helped
